_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: T105 Oleum storage tank and dike
_prev_prog_3.Description: Oleum storage tanks are located inside of an impervious dike. The maximum tank levels are administratively managed with instruments to control the maximum heights, and fill controls that prevent over filling. The tanks are inspected every 10 years by state approved and licensed inspectors. The tankwagon offloading area is bermed along with an interlocking drain valve and venting system, and is capable of containing greater than 3 volumes of a tankwagon. There is a fixed vapor suppression system in place to cover the entire 5000 square foot tankwagon bermed area with white oil. There are also on-site, two (2) HM200 hazmat foam nozzles and a foam proportioning, pumper fire truck, loaded with 1000 gallons of foam capable of suppressing vapors. We have trained and equipped emergency responders on-site with a municipal, volunteer fire station located less than .1 miles from this facility. We are members of the Tri-State Mutual Industrial Aid Group. This group is comprised of 25+ industries that are pledged to respond with equipment and operators at another members request for aid. We are in direct communication with the Delaware County Emergency Services by portable and mobile radios on-site. We have a plant emergency alarm system and evacuation procedure along with every telephone in the facility able to directly dial 911 outside emergency services.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Stoney Creek Technologies (SCT) is an internationally known manufacturer of Sulfonates with a manufacturing facility located in Trainer, PA. There are currently 30 employees at this facility.

SCT manufactures and markets world-wide, a series of corrosion inhibitors under the trade name SACI (Severe Atmospheric Corrosion Inhibitor). Additionally, SCT is currently toll-producing oil and fuel, and metalworking additives for multiple customers.

Stoney Creek Technologies operates all processes in an environmentally responsible manner. SCT believes that safety is unequivocally our number one priority. We have an excellent employee driven safety program and an outstanding safety record.

In the manufacturing of SACI and the oil, fuel and metal working additives, SCT uses one regulated substance, Oleum (fuming sulfuric acid). This raw material is used in the production of sulfonic acids, which are the building blocks for our products. The chemical is received at our facility by tankwagon and is unloaded into one of two registered horizontal carbon steel storage tanks with a capacity of 18,000 gallons each. A dike designed to contain the oleum surrounds the storage tanks. SCT's written operational procedure administratively holds the maximum level at 10,000 gallons. High level alarms are set at 10,858 gallons with high-high level alarms set at 12,530. A separate, high, high level shut-off system prevents further offloading and shuts the offloading process completely down at 14, 738 gallons.

The controls now in place to limit the quanity released include the following:
Administrative Controls to set the maximum levels in each tank.
Separate high level alarms with interlock shut-off switches.
A concrete retention wall (dike).
Tankwagon unloading retention basin with automatic shut-off / depressurization switch.
Remote emergency shut-off switch.
Fixed white oil system (for vapor supression).
Fixed water monitors (for vapor suppression).
HM200 HAZMAT foam nozzles (for vapor s

uppression).

SCT has a documented spill prevention program. Practices, which are part of our operational SOP and accidental release program include numerous technological systems including back up systems and redundacies, procedural and managerial practices, PM and employee training in prevention of accidental releases and how to respond should one occur. SCT has an Intergrated Contingency Plan in place which includes our Spill Prevention Containment and Countermeasures, Preparedness, Prevention and Contingency, Spill Prevention Resonse Plans, and the DOT Security Plan.

The SCT emergency response program includes:
Direct communication with the local fire board and LEPC via portable and mobile two-way radios.
A plant-wide alarm system.
All telephones in this facility are able to directly call 911 outside emergency services.
Mobile fire equipment.
Trained and equipped HAZMAT responders.
Mutual aid  with area refineries.
Local volunteer fire fighters that have been trained in vapor suppression and in the operation of our Foam Pumper Fire Truck. 

In the last 5 years there have been no accidental releases of the regulated substance under Stoney Creek Technologies.
SCT has recently completed a Process Safety Hazard Review for our process ultilizing oleum; the recommendations for this audit are being evaluated.
